channel.title: Comments on: How to use Jetpack Image CDN without Jetpack plugin

item.title: By: AOMIE
item.dc:creator: AOMIE
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://netmiko.com/use-jetpack-cdn-without-jetpack-plugin/#comment-12">Supertrooper</a>.
By contacting jetpack plugin support at <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/jetpack/" rel="nofollow ugc">https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/jetpack/</a>.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Supertrooper.

By contacting jetpack plugin support at https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/jetpack/.

item.title: By: Supertrooper
item.dc:creator: Supertrooper
item.description: Thanks for this great tutorial introducing CDN Enabler with custom PHP code. After uploading images they are immediately cached in the CDN, and we don't see any way to purge them from the cache after compressing using ShortPixel. How can we purge the larger images from the CDN cache?
item.content:encoded: Thanks for this great tutorial introducing CDN Enabler with custom PHP code. After uploading images they are immediately cached in the CDN, and we don’t see any way to purge them from the cache after compressing using ShortPixel. How can we purge the larger images from the CDN cache?

item.title: By: AOMIE
item.dc:creator: AOMIE
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://netmiko.com/use-jetpack-cdn-without-jetpack-plugin/#comment-10">Ganesh Debnath</a>.
hi, I saw your site. the images are loading through the cdn. Jetpack cdn only works with png and jpg file types and not with svg and other file types. You should use statically cdn instead if you want all image file types to load through cdn. <a href="https://netmiko.com/tutorials/use-statically-cdn-on-a-wordpress-blog/" rel="nofollow ugc">https://netmiko.com/tutorials/use-statically-cdn-on-a-wordpress-blog/</a>
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Ganesh Debnath.

hi, I saw your site. the images are loading through the cdn. Jetpack cdn only works with png and jpg file types and not with svg and other file types. You should use statically cdn instead if you want all image file types to load through cdn. https://netmiko.com/tutorials/use-statically-cdn-on-a-wordpress-blog/
